info.description:
Describes a Customer API for managing technical changes.
 
**Release: pre-release 1.0.0**

### Internationalization
By default, data are in English but you can request data in French by specifying a language code in the Accept-Language header.
_Example: Accept-Language: fr_

### Resources 
- **requests** : A request defines a demand for changing configuration, hardware or services.
- **attachments** : A attachment defines all files about request.
- **notes** : A note defines all comments on the request.
- **steps** : A step defines the follow-up of the request.
- **catalogItems** :  A catalog defines request's category.
- **version** : provide the version of the API.
- **status** : used to know the status of API components.
- **doc** : download the swagger of the API.

### Change for Business API performs the following operations :
- Create or update a request, retrieve a request or a collection of requests depending on filter criteria.
- Retrieve a collection of attachments depending on filter criteria.
- Create a note, retrieve a collection of notes depending on filter criteria.
- Retrieve a collection of steps depending on filter criteria.
- Retrieve a catalog item or a collection of catalog items depending on filter criteria.
 

### OAuth 2.0 Scopes

| Scope | Features |
| --- | --- |
| b2b:change:readonly | Allow to track change requests |

***
Copyright Â© OBS 2019. All Rights Reserved.
info.title: API ChangesForBusiness

post.description:
This end-point allows to send a new request. 
**Only one request is support in the sandbox**

400.description:
Bad Request

List of supported error codes:
- 20: Invalid URL parameter value
- 21: Missing body
- 22: Invalid body
- 23: Missing body field
- 24: Invalid body field
- 25: Missing header
- 26: Invalid header value
- 27: Missing query-string parameter
- 28: Invalid query-string parameter value

Forbidden

List of supported error codes:
- 50: Access denied
- 51: Forbidden requester
- 52: Forbidden user
- 53: Too many requests

404.description:
Not Found

List of supported error codes:
- 60: Resource not found

Method Not Allowed

List of supported error codes:
- 61: Method not allowed

- 5: The service is temporarily unavailable
- 6: Orange API is over capacity, retry later !

get.description: This end-point allows to retrieve a list of change requests.

parameters.name: customerReference
parameters.description: Returns requests with the given external reference.

parameters.name: catalog
parameters.description: Returns requests of the given catalog.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Returns requests of the given type. (catalog query parameter must also be provided)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first element to retrieve. Zero is the first item of the collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to retrieve.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
The list of field names to retrieve.  You can specify a field, a resource or a resource's field.
*Example: &fields=reference,status,type,primaryContact.name*

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The comma-separated list of field names to sort the result. Prefixing a field name with a "-" sign will indicate a descending order

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Returns requests of the given state

parameters.name: subState
parameters.description: Returns requests of the given sub state.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description:
Returns requests created in the given partial interval. date provided must be in format "YYYY-MM-DD".
*Example: &createdAt=,2019-12-20* returns requests created before 20 December 2019

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Returns requests related to the string provided (site name, request id or a product reference).

X-Total-Count.description: The total number of items matching criteria.

X-Result-Count.description: The actual number of items returned in the response body.

Segment.description: Segment of the Customer (France or International)

SubState.description: List different sub status of a change. Work in progress

State.description: List different status of a change

Priority.description: List the different priorities of a change

ImplementationMode.description: List of implementation Mode. Work in progress

ReportTypes.description: List the available reports on Incident Management

ImplementationModeLight.description:
The required fields for each mode are as follows:

standardLeadTime -> no date required.

requestedDate -> requestedAt -> "YYYY-MM-DD".

requestedDateAndTime  -> requestedPeriod ( startedAt, endedAt ) -> datetime format should be "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mmZ".

noneBusinessHours -> requestedPeriod ( startedAt, endedAt ) -> datetime format should be "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mmZ".

RequestFields.description: Allow to return a partial list of attributes

id.description: Unique identifier of the customer account

segment.description:
Type of the Customer.
_Example FR or INT_

title.description: The title of the person :  Mr., Mrs., or Miss

name.description: The title and the first and last name of the person.

lastName.description: The last name of the person

firstName.description: The first name of the person

phone.description: The phone number.  Phone numbers must follow Rec.E164 without "+" prefix (see www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/)

mobile.description: The mobile number.  Phone numbers must follow Rec.E164 without "+" prefix (see www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/)

email.description: The email address of the person

catalog.description: Catalog name of the request. Use /catalogItem to retrieve the catalog name.

type.description: Type of the request. Use /catalogItem to retrieve the request name.

createdAt.description:
Date when the request was created. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

updatedAt.description:
Date when the request was last updated . Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

format.description: Type of the extension of the file

size.description: Size of the file in kb

url.description: URL on the file for download it

body.description: Content of the file encoded in Base64

requestId.description: Single identifier of the request where the file is linked.

createdAt.description: Date of the availability of the file

updatedAt.description: Date of the last update of the file. The current implementation, this date is always the same as createdAt as it is not possible to update a file.

AttachmentPOST.description: Model describing an attachment for the creation

name.description: Name of the file including the extension(ex .txt).

body.description: Content of the file encoded in base64

Note.description: Model describing a note on a change

createdAt.description:
Date when the event was created. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

updatedAt.description:
Date when the event was last updated. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

id.description: Single identifier of the catalog item.

schema.description: Json schema describing the catalog item.

isActive.description: If the catalog item is active.

createdAt.description:
Date when the catalog item was created. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

updatedAt.description:
Date when the catalog item was last updated. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

parameters.description: Parameters of the report request.

Step.description: Describe the Step of the  Change Management workflow

createdAt.description:
Date when the step was created. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

updatedAt.description:
Date when the step was last updated. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

version.description: API version (major dot minor dot patch numbers).

servicePointPOST.description: Model describing a location. It is mandatory to indicate a location id or location name if product id is not set.

title.description: The title of the person :  Mr., Mrs., or Miss

name.description: The title and the first and last name of the person.

lastName.description: The last name of the person

firstName.description: The first name of the person

phone.description: The phone number.  Phone numbers must follow Rec.E164 without "+" prefix (see www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/)

mobile.description: The mobile number.  Phone numbers must follow Rec.E164 without "+" prefix (see www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/)

email.description: The email address of the person

NotePOST.description: Model describing a note on create

id.description: Single identifier of the catalog item.

requestedAt.description: Required ONLY for the mode "requestedDate" and should be with the format "YYYY-MM-DD".

type.description: Type of the request.  Use /catalogItem to retrieve the request name.

caution.description: This field must have the value 72h.
Mandatory file with the value 72h. For this type of request, an attachment file is required

ProductPOST.description: Model describing a product. It is mandatory to indicate a product id if location id and location name are not set.

attachments.description: uri for retrieving attachments of the current item

notes.description: uri for retrieving notes of the current item

steps.description: uri for retrieving steps of the current item

ModePeriod.description:
Required ONLY for the mode "requestedDateAndTime" and "noneBusinessHours".

"startedAt" and "endedAt" format should be "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mmZ".

startedAt.description: Start date of the period in "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mmZ" format.

endedAt.description: End date of the period in "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mmZ" format.

type.description: Type of the request.  Use /catalogItem to retrieve the request name.

scopes.b2b:changeRequests: Allow to manage your change requests
scopes.b2b:changeRequests:read: Allow to track your change requests
